TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider extends System.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationProvider

Docs.summary: Provides a <see cref="T:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationProvider"> instance that uses RSA encryption to encrypt and decrypt configuration data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider class gives you a way to encrypt sensitive information stored in a configuration file, which helps protect it from unauthorized access. You use the built-in RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider instance by declaring the provider and making appropriate settings in the configuration file instead of creating an instance of this class, as shown in the example later in this topic.
The RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider object uses the cryptography functions provided by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSA> class to encrypt and decrypt configuration sections.
> [!NOTE] > Before ASP.NET can decrypt encrypted information in your configuration file, the identity of your ASP.NET application must have read access to the encryption key used to encrypt and decrypt the configuration data. For more information, see [Walkthrough: Encrypting Configuration Information Using Protected Configuration](../Topic/Walkthrough:%20Encrypting%20Configuration%20Information%20Using%20Protected%20Configuration.md).
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the standard RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider to protect or unprotect a configuration section.
[!CODE [System.Configuration.RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider#1)]
The following example shows an excerpt from a configuration file after encryption.
``` <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <configuration> <connectionStrings configProtectionProvider="RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider"> <EncryptedData Type="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#Element" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#"> <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#tripledes-cbc" /> <KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#"> <EncryptedKey xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#"> <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5" /> <KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#"> <KeyName>Rsa Key</KeyName> </KeyInfo> <CipherData> <CipherValue>B702tRDVHJjC3CYXt7I0ucCDjdht/Vyk/DdUhwQyt7vepSD85dwCP8ox9Y1BUdjajFeTFfFBsGypbli5HPGRYamQdrVkPo07bBBXNT5H02qxREguGUU4iDtV1Xp8BLVZjQMV4ZgP6Wbctw2xRvPC7GvKHLI4fUN/Je5LmutsijA=</CipherValue> </CipherData> </EncryptedKey> </KeyInfo> <CipherData> <CipherValue></CipherValue> </CipherData> </EncryptedData> </connectionStrings> </configuration> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider"> class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddKey (int keySize, bool exportable);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddKey(int32 keySize, bool exportable) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the key to add.
`true` to indicate that the key is exportable; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Adds a key to the RSA key container.
Gets the name of the Windows cryptography API (crypto API) cryptographic service provider (CSP).
Docs.value: The name of the CryptoAPI cryptographic service provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode Decrypt(class System.Xml.XmlNode encryptedNode) cil managed

Docs.summary: Decrypts the XML node passed to it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteKey() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes a key from the RSA key container.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode Encrypt(class System.Xml.XmlNode node) cil managed

Docs.summary: Encrypts the XML node passed to it.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExportKey (string xmlFileName, bool includePrivateParameters);
.method public hidebysig instance void ExportKey(string xmlFileName, bool includePrivateParameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The file name and path to export the key to.
`true` to indicate that private parameters are exported; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Exports an RSA key from the key container.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ImportKey (string xmlFileName, bool exportable);
.method public hidebysig instance void ImportKey(string xmlFileName, bool exportable) cil managed

Docs.param: The file name and path to import the key from.
`true` to indicate that the key is exportable; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Imports an RSA key into the key container.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Initialize (string name, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection configurationValues);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(string name, class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection configurationValues) cil managed

Docs.param: The provider name to use for the object.
A <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection> collection of values to use when initializing the object.
Docs.summary: Initializes the provider with default settings.
Gets the name of the key container.
Docs.value: The name of the key container.

Docs.summary: Gets the public key used by the provider.
Docs.value: An <see cref="T:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAParameters"> object that contains the public key used by the provider.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the provider uses FIPS.
Docs.value: `true` if the provider uses FIPS; otherwise, `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider"> object is using the machine key container.
Docs.value: `true` if the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider"> object is using the machine key container; otherwise, `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the provider is using Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP) key exchange data.
Docs.value: `true` if the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.RsaProtectedConfigurationProvider"> object is using Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP) key exchange data; otherwise, `false`.
